item.title: Data Generating Process Simulation: The opossum package
item.description: Data Generating Process Simulation¶ 1  Introduction1.1  Topic1.2  Motivation1.3  Properties2  Review2.1  Literature2.2  Software3  Theory behind the package3.1  General Model: Partial Linear Regression3.2  Generating Covariates3.2.1  Continuous Covariates3.2.2  Binary and categorical covariates3.3  Treatment assignment3.3.1  Random3.3.2  Dependent on covariates3.4  Treatment effects3.4.1  Positive & negative constant effect3.4.2  Positive & negative continuous heterogeneous effect3.4.3  No effect3.4.4  Discrete heterogeneous treatment effect3.5  Output variable3.5.1  Continuous3.5.2  Binary4  Package application4.1  Choosing covariates4.2  Creating treatment effects4.3  Creating output4.4  Other functions5  Example: Applying double machine learning6  Discussion7  References Introduction¶Topic¶As modern science becomes increasingly data-driven among virtually all fields, it is obligatory to inspect not only how scientists analyze data but also what kind of data is used.
